description:
In music.kit an chord is a list of notes or intervals ordered
by pitch

The `chord` module has functions to create and manipulate chord

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * In music.kit an chord is a list of notes or intervals ordered
 * by pitch
 *
 * The `chord` module has functions to create and manipulate chord
 *
 * @example
 * var kit = require('music.kit')
 * kit.chord('1 3 5 6', 'G') // => ['G', 'B', 'D', 'E']
 * kit.chord.get('Cmaj7') // => ['C', 'E', 'G', 'B']
 */
var chord = require('./chord/build')
chord.get = require('./chord/get')
chord.names = require('./chord/names')

module.exports = chord

examples: var kit = require('music.kit') kit.chord('1 3 5 6', 'G') // => ['G', 'B', 'D', 'E'] kit.chord.get('Cmaj7') // => ['C', 'E', 'G', 'B']
name: chord

description:
Build a chord from a source and a tonic. A chord is a list of notes or
intervals in asceding pitch order

The source can be a list of intervals or notes. The tonic must be
a pitch (with or without octave) or false to get the intervals

This function is currified, so you can partially apply the function passing
one parameter instead of two (see example)

This function is exported as 'chord' (instead of 'chord.build') in music.kit

tags.title: param
tags.description: the list of intervals or notes
tags.name: source

tags.title: param
tags.description: the tonic of the chord or null to get the intervals
tags.name: tonic

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the chord notes (or intervals if null tonic)

tags.title: example
example

context.code:
var harmonics = require('../gamut/harmonics')
var transpose = require('../note/transpose')

/**
 * Build a chord from a source and a tonic. A chord is a list of notes or
 * intervals in asceding pitch order
 *
 * The source can be a list of intervals or notes. The tonic must be
 * a pitch (with or without octave) or false to get the intervals
 *
 * This function is currified, so you can partially apply the function passing
 * one parameter instead of two (see example)
 *
 * This function is exported as 'chord' (instead of 'chord.build') in music.kit
 *
 * @name chord.build
 * @param {Array} source - the list of intervals or notes
 * @param {String} tonic - the tonic of the chord or null to get the intervals
 * @return {Array} the chord notes (or intervals if null tonic)
 *
 * @example
 * var chord = require('music.kit/chord/build')
 * chord('1 3 5 6', 'G') // => ['G', 'B', 'D', 'E']
 * var maj79 = chord('C E G B D')
 * maj79('A4') // => ['A4', 'C#5', 'E5', 'G#5', 'B5']
 *
 * @example
 * // exported as chord
 * var kit = require('music.kit')
 * kit.chord('1 3 5', 'C')
 */
module.exports = function (notes, tonic) {
  var h = harmonics(notes)
  return h.map(transpose(tonic))
}

name: chord.build

params.title: param
params.description: the list of intervals or notes
params.name: source

params.title: param
params.description: the tonic of the chord or null to get the intervals
params.name: tonic

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the chord notes (or intervals if null tonic)

examples: var chord = require('music.kit/chord/build') chord('1 3 5 6', 'G') // => ['G', 'B', 'D', 'E'] var maj79 = chord('C E G B D') maj79('A4') // => ['A4', 'C#5', 'E5', 'G#5', 'B5']
// exported as chord var kit = require('music.kit') kit.chord('1 3 5', 'C')

description: Chord dictionary

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var chords = require('music.kit/chord/dictionary')
chords['Maj7'] // => { name: 'Maj7', intervals: ['1', '3', ...], aliases: [] }

context.code:
'use strict'

var data = require('./chords.json')
var dictionary = require('../dictionary/build')

/**
 * Chord dictionary
 *
 * @name chord.dictionary
 * @kind constant
 *
 * @example
 * var chords = require('music.kit/chord/dictionary')
 * chords['Maj7'] // => { name: 'Maj7', intervals: ['1', '3', ...], aliases: [] }
 */
module.exports = dictionary(data)

name: chord.dictionary
examples: var chords = require('music.kit/chord/dictionary') chords['Maj7'] // => { name: 'Maj7', intervals: ['1', '3', ...], aliases: [] }

description:
Get a chord by name using a dictionary.

You can get chord notes with a note as tonic or the chord intervals by passing
`false` as tonic

There is two ways to get a chord:
- With type and tonic: `chord.get('Maj7', 'C')`
- With tonic included in name: `chord.get('CMaj7')`

This function can be partially applied (see examples)

tags.title: param
tags.description: the chord name (optionally can include the tonic)
tags.name: name

tags.title: returns
tags.description: a data object with the chord properties

tags.title: example

context.code:
'use strict'

var chords = require('./dictionary')
var getter = require('../dictionary/getter')

/**
 * Get a chord by name using a dictionary.
 *
 * You can get chord notes with a note as tonic or the chord intervals by passing
 * `false` as tonic
 *
 * There is two ways to get a chord:
 * - With type and tonic: `chord.get('Maj7', 'C')`
 * - With tonic included in name: `chord.get('CMaj7')`
 *
 * This function can be partially applied (see examples)
 *
 * @name chord.get
 * @function
 * @param {String} name - the chord name (optionally can include the tonic)
 * @return {Object} a data object with the chord properties
 *
 * @example
 * var get = require('music.kit/chord/get')
 * // with name and tonic
 * get('Maj7', 'C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']
 * // with tonic inside the name
 * get('C major') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']
 * // partially applied
 * var major = get('major')
 * major('C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']
 */
module.exports = getter(chords)

name: chord.get

params.title: param
params.description: the chord name (optionally can include the tonic)
params.name: name

returns.title: returns
returns.description: a data object with the chord properties

examples: var get = require('music.kit/chord/get') // with name and tonic get('Maj7', 'C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B'] // with tonic inside the name get('C major') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B'] // partially applied var major = get('major') major('C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']

description: Given a list of notes get the chord names

tags.title: returns
tags.description: an array of chord names or all known chord names if no arguments provided

tags.title: example
tags.description:
// get all known chord names
chord.names() // => ['Maj7', 'm7', ... ] (109 names)
chord.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]
chord.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]

context.code:
'use strict'

var data = require('./chords.json')
var names = require('../dictionary/names')
var chords = require('./dictionary')

/**
 * Given a list of notes get the chord names
 *
 * @name chord.names
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} notes - the chord notes
 * @return {Array} an array of chord names or all known chord names if no arguments provided
 *
 * @example
 * // get all known chord names
 * chord.names() // => ['Maj7', 'm7', ... ] (109 names)
 * chord.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]
 * chord.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]
 */
module.exports = names(Object.keys(data), chords, '')

name: chord.names

returns.title: returns
returns.description: an array of chord names or all known chord names if no arguments provided

examples: // get all known chord names chord.names() // => ['Maj7', 'm7', ... ] (109 names) chord.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ] chord.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]

description:
Dictionary is a module to work with dictionaries of pitch collections

Its the foundation of the scale and chord dictionary of music.kit

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * Dictionary is a module to work with dictionaries of pitch collections
 *
 * Its the foundation of the scale and chord dictionary of music.kit
 *
 */
var d = require('./dictionary/build')
d.getter = require('./dictionary/getter')
d.names = require('./dictionary/names')
d.splitName = require('./dictionary/splitName')
module.exports = d

name: d

description:
Create a dictionary

The data is a hash map of keys associated to arrays. The array contains:

- A interval list (as string or as array)
- (Optionally) an array of name aliases

This function is exported in music.kit as ´dictionary´  (see example)

tags.title: example
example

context.code:
'use strict'

var binary = require('../set/binary')

/**
 * Create a dictionary
 *
 * The data is a hash map of keys associated to arrays. The array contains:
 *
 * - A interval list (as string or as array)
 * - (Optionally) an array of name aliases
 *
 * This function is exported in music.kit as ´dictionary´  (see example)
 *
 * @name dictionary.build
 * @function
 * @param {Hash} data - the dictionary data
 * @return {Hash} the dictionary
 *
 * @example
 * var dictionary = require('music.kit/dictionary/build')
 * var chords = dictionary({'Maj7', ['1 3 5 7', ['maj7', 'M7']]})
 *
 * // get chord by name
 * chords['Maj7'].name = 'Maj7'
 * chords['Maj7'].aliases = ['maj7', 'M7']
 * chords['Maj7'].intervals // => ['1', '3', '5', '7']
 *
 * // get chord by aliases
 * chords['maj7'].intervals // => ['1', '3', '5', '7']
 * chords['maj7'].name // => 'Maj7'
 * chords['M7'].intervals // => ['1', '3', '5', '7']
 * chords['M7'].name // => 'Maj7'
 *
 * // get chord by binary numbers
 * chords['100010010001'].name // => 'Maj7'
 * chords[2193].name // => 'Maj7'
 *
 * @example
 * var kit = require('music.kit')
 * // this function is exported as `dictionary` not `dictionary.build`
 * kit.dictionary(...)
 */
module.exports = function (data) {
  return Object.keys(data).reduce(function (dict, n) {
    var s = { name: n, intervals: data[n][0].split(' '), aliases: data[n][1] || [] }
    s.binary = binary(s.intervals)
    s.decimal = parseInt(s.binary, 2)
    dict[n] = dict[s.binary] = dict[s.decimal] = s
    s.aliases.forEach(function (a) { dict[a] = s })
    return dict
  }, {})
}

name: dictionary.build

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the dictionary

examples: var dictionary = require('music.kit/dictionary/build') var chords = dictionary({'Maj7', ['1 3 5 7', ['maj7', 'M7']]}) // get chord by name chords['Maj7'].name = 'Maj7' chords['Maj7'].aliases = ['maj7', 'M7'] chords['Maj7'].intervals // => ['1', '3', '5', '7'] // get chord by aliases chords['maj7'].intervals // => ['1', '3', '5', '7'] chords['maj7'].name // => 'Maj7' chords['M7'].intervals // => ['1', '3', '5', '7'] chords['M7'].name // => 'Maj7' // get chord by binary numbers chords['100010010001'].name // => 'Maj7' chords[2193].name // => 'Maj7'
var kit = require('music.kit') // this function is exported as `dictionary` not `dictionary.build` kit.dictionary(...)

description: Given a dictionary return a function to get the notes or intervals from it

tags.title: returns
tags.description: a function to get the notes or intervals from the set dictionary

tags.title: example

name: dictionary.getter

returns.title: returns
returns.description: a function to get the notes or intervals from the set dictionary

examples: var d = dictionary({'Maj7': ['1 3 5 7'], 'm7': ['1 3b 5 7b'] }) var get = getter(d) get('CMaj7') // => ['C', 'E', 'G', 'B']

tags.title: returns

name: dictionary.names

returns.title: returns
returns.description: a function to perform inverse lookup

description:
In music.kit a gamut is a collection of intervals, pitch classes or notes.
Scales, chords, pitch sets are examples of gamuts.

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * In music.kit a gamut is a collection of intervals, pitch classes or notes.
 * Scales, chords, pitch sets are examples of gamuts.
 *
 * @name gamut
 */
module.exports = {
  sort: require('./gamut/sort'),
  harmonics: require('./gamut/harmonics'),
  operation: require('./gamut/operation'),
  split: require('./gamut/split'),
  rotate: require('./gamut/rotate'),
  select: require('./gamut/select')
}

name: gamut

description:
Get a set from a binary set number and (optionally) a tonic. If the tonic is
a note, you get a pitch set. If its false you get a interval set.

tags.title: param
tags.description: the first note of the set or false to get the intervals
tags.name: tonic

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the set pitch classes (note names without octaves)

tags.title: example

name: gamut.fromBinary

params.title: param
params.description: the first note of the set or false to get the intervals
params.name: tonic

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the set pitch classes (note names without octaves)

examples: var fromBinary = require('music.kit/gamut.fromBinary') // use a 12 digit binary number: fromBinary('101011010101', 'C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B'] // or its decimal equivalent: fromBinary(2773, 'C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B'] // get the interval set by passing `false` as tonic: fromBinary(2773, false) // => ['1P', '2M', '3M', '4', '5', '6M', '7M']

description:
Get the distances from the first note of a gamut to the rest of notes

Pitch classes are treated as notes with octave equal 0
name: gamut.harmonics
examples: gamut.harmonics('c2 e2 g2') // => ['1P', '3M', '5P']

description: Apply a function to an array of array pitches
name: gamut.operation

description: Rotate the gamut

tags.title: param
tags.description: a list of notes or intervals
tags.name: gamut

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var rotate = require('music.kit/gamut/rotate')
rotate(1, 'C D E') // => ['D', 'E', 'C']

context.code:
'use strict'

var split = require('./split')
/**
 * Rotate the gamut
 *
 * @name gamut.rotate
 * @function
 * @param {Integer} count - the number of rotations
 * @param {String|Array} gamut - a list of notes or intervals
 * @return {Array} the gamut rotated count times
 *
 * @example
 * var rotate = require('music.kit/gamut/rotate')
 * rotate(1, 'C D E') // => ['D', 'E', 'C']
 */
module.exports = function (count, source) {
  var g = split(source)
  var len = g.length
  var n = ((count % len) + len) % len
  return g.slice(n, len).concat(g.slice(0, n))
}

name: gamut.rotate

params.title: param
params.description: a list of notes or intervals
params.name: gamut

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the gamut rotated count times

examples: var rotate = require('music.kit/gamut/rotate') rotate(1, 'C D E') // => ['D', 'E', 'C']

description: Select some elements from a gamut

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var select = require('music.kit/gamut/select')
select('1 3 5', 'C D E F G A B') // => ['C', 'E', 'G']

name: gamut.select

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the selected elements

examples: var select = require('music.kit/gamut/select') select('1 3 5', 'C D E F G A B') // => ['C', 'E', 'G']

description: Get a gamut in ascdening pitch order

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the gamut in sort pitch order

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var sort = require('music.kit/gamut.sort')
sort('c5 d2 f4 D2') // => ['D2', 'D2', 'F4', 'C5']

name: gamut.sort

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the gamut in sort pitch order

examples: var sort = require('music.kit/gamut.sort') sort('c5 d2 f4 D2') // => ['D2', 'D2', 'F4', 'C5']

description:
Convert a source to an array. If the source is an array, return it.

Aside from an array itself, the source can be a
string with elements separated by spaces, commas or bars (`|`) or a single
element that will be wrapped inside an array

This function __does not perform any transformation__ of the array elements.
and __it always return an array, even if its empty__.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
split = require('music.kit/gamut.split')
split('a | B C , Dmaj7') // => ['a', 'B', 'C', 'Dmaj7']
split() // => []

context.code:
var SEP = /\s*\|\s*|\s*,\s*|\s+/

/**
 * Convert a source to an array. If the source is an array, return it.
 *
 * Aside from an array itself, the source can be a
 * string with elements separated by spaces, commas or bars (`|`) or a single
 * element that will be wrapped inside an array
 *
 * This function __does not perform any transformation__ of the array elements.
 * and __it always return an array, even if its empty__.
 *
 * @name gamut.split
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} source - the source
 * @return {Array} the source as array
 *
 * @example
 * split = require('music.kit/gamut.split')
 * split('a | B C , Dmaj7') // => ['a', 'B', 'C', 'Dmaj7']
 * split() // => []
 */
module.exports = function (source) {
  if (Array.isArray(source)) return source
  else if (typeof source === 'string') return source.trim().split(SEP)
  else if (source === null || typeof source === 'undefined') return []
  else return [ source ]
}

name: gamut.split

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the source as array

examples: split = require('music.kit/gamut.split') split('a | B C , Dmaj7') // => ['a', 'B', 'C', 'Dmaj7'] split() // => []

description:
In music.kit an interval is a string with the format `number[quality|accidentals]`

The interval module has functions to create and manipulate intervals

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * In music.kit an interval is a string with the format `number[quality|accidentals]`
 *
 * The interval module has functions to create and manipulate intervals
 *
 * @name interval
 */
module.exports = {
  parse: require('./interval/parse'),
  build: require('./interval/str')
}

name: interval

description:
Convert a [interval shorthand notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interval_(music)#Shorthand_notation)
to [array interval notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)

This function is cached for better performance.

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the interval in array notation or null if not a valid interval

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var parse = require('music.kit/interval.parse')
parse('3m') // => [2, -1, 0]
parse('9b') // => [1, -1, 1]
parse('-2M') // => [6, -1, -1]

context.code:
'use strict'

var INTERVAL = /^([-+]?)(\d+)(d{1,4}|m|M|P|A{1,4}|b{1,4}|#{1,4}|)$/
var TYPES = 'PMMPPMM'
var QALT = {
  P: { dddd: -4, ddd: -3, dd: -2, d: -1, P: 0, A: 1, AA: 2, AAA: 3, AAAA: 4 },
  M: { ddd: -4, dd: -3, d: -2, m: -1, M: 0, A: 1, AA: 2, AAA: 3, AAAA: 4 }
}
var cache = {}

/**
 * Convert a [interval shorthand notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interval_(music)#Shorthand_notation)
 * to [array interval notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)
 *
 * This function is cached for better performance.
 *
 * @name interval.parse
 * @function
 * @param {String} interval - the interval string
 * @return {Array} the interval in array notation or null if not a valid interval
 *
 * @example
 * var parse = require('music.kit/interval.parse')
 * parse('3m') // => [2, -1, 0]
 * parse('9b') // => [1, -1, 1]
 * parse('-2M') // => [6, -1, -1]
 */
module.exports = function (str) {
  if (typeof str !== 'string') return null
  return str in cache ? cache[str] : cache[str] = parse(str)
}

var BASES = [ [0, 0], [2, -1], [4, -2], [-1, 1], [1, 0], [3, -1], [5, -2] ]
function parse (str) {
  var m = INTERVAL.exec(str)
  if (!m) return null
  var dir = m[1] === '-' ? -1 : 1
  var num = +m[2] - 1

  var simple = num % 7
  var base = BASES[simple]

  var alt
  if (m[3] === '') alt = 0
  else if (m[3][0] === '#') alt = m[3].length
  else if (m[3][0] === 'b') alt = -m[3].length
  else {
    alt = QALT[TYPES[simple]][m[3]]
    if (typeof alt === 'undefined') return null
  }
  var oct = dir * Math.floor(num / 7)
  return [dir * (base[0] + 7 * alt), oct + dir * (base[1] - 4 * alt)]
}

name: interval.parse

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the interval in array notation or null if not a valid interval

examples: var parse = require('music.kit/interval.parse') parse('3m') // => [2, -1, 0] parse('9b') // => [1, -1, 1] parse('-2M') // => [6, -1, -1]

description:
Convert from [array interval notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)
to [shorthand interval notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interval_(music)#Shorthand_notation)

The returned string has the form: `number + quality` where number is the interval number
(positive integer for ascending intervals, negative integer for descending intervals, never 0)
and the quality is one of: 'M', 'm', 'P', 'd', 'A' (major, minor, perfect, dimished, augmented)

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the interval string in shorthand notation or null if not valid interval

name: interval.str

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the interval string in shorthand notation or null if not valid interval

examples: interval.str([1, 0, 0]) // => '2M' interval.str([1, 0, 1]) // => '9M'

description:
music.kit is a compact library to manipulate music abstractions (not actual music)
and while its designed to create algorithmic composition programs,
can be use to develop any kind of midi or audio software.

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * music.kit is a compact library to manipulate music abstractions (not actual music)
 * and while its designed to create algorithmic composition programs,
 * can be use to develop any kind of midi or audio software.
 *
 * @name music.kit
 */
var kit = {}
kit.note = require('./note')
kit.transpose = kit.note.transpose
kit.pitch = require('./pitch')
kit.interval = require('./interval')
kit.gamut = require('./gamut')
kit.set = require('./set')
kit.scale = require('./scale')
kit.chord = require('./chord')
kit.dictionary = require('./dictionary')

if (typeof module === 'object' && module.exports) module.exports = kit
if (typeof window !== 'undefined') window.kit = kit

name: music.kit

description:
In music.kit a note is represented by string, usually in scientific notation.

The note module provides functions to manipulate notes:

- Scientific notation: `note.parse` and `note.str`
- Midi and frequencies: `note.midi`, `note.freq`, `note.fromMidi`
- Note properties: `note.pitchClass`, `note.setOctave`
- Enharmonics: `note.enharmonics`
- Transposition and distances: `note.transpose`, `note.distance`

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * In music.kit a note is represented by string, usually in scientific notation.
 *
 * The note module provides functions to manipulate notes:
 *
 * - Scientific notation: `note.parse` and `note.str`
 * - Midi and frequencies: `note.midi`, `note.freq`, `note.fromMidi`
 * - Note properties: `note.pitchClass`, `note.setOctave`
 * - Enharmonics: `note.enharmonics`
 * - Transposition and distances: `note.transpose`, `note.distance`
 */
var note = require('./note/name')
note.parse = require('./note/parse')
note.str = require('./note/str')

note.midi = require('./note/midi')
note.fromMidi = require('./note/fromMidi')
note.freq = require('./note/freq')

// manipulation
note.pitchClass = require('./note/pitchClass')
note.setOctave = require('./note/setOctave')

note.enharmonics = require('./note/enharmonics')
note.transpose = require('./note/transpose')
note.distance = require('./note/distance')

module.exports = note

name: note

description:
Get the interval between two notes

This function can be partially applied (see examples)

context.code:
var curry = require('../_curry')
var operation = require('../pitch/operation')

/**
 * Get the interval between two notes
 *
 * This function can be partially applied (see examples)
 *
 * @name note.distance
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} from - the first note
 * @param {String|Array} to - the other note
 * @return {String|Array} the interval between them
 */
module.exports = curry(operation(function (a, b) {
  if (!Array.isArray(a) || !Array.isArray(b) || a.length === 1 || b.length === 1) return null
  return [b[0] - a[0], b[1] - a[1]]
}))

name: note.distance

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the interval between them

description:
Get the enharmonics of a note. It returns an array of three elements: the
below enharmonic, the note, and the upper enharmonic

tags.title: param
tags.description: the pitch to get the enharmonics from
tags.name: pitch

tags.title: returns
tags.description: an array of pitches ordered by distance to the given one

tags.title: example
tags.description:
enharmonics = require('music.kit/note.enharmonics')
enharmonics('C') // => ['B#', 'C', 'Dbb']
enharmonics('A') // => ['G##', 'A', 'Bbb']
enharmonics('C#4') // => ['B##3', 'C#4' 'Db4']
enharmonics('Db') // => ['C#', 'Db', 'Ebbb'])

context.code:
'use strict'

var transpose = require('./transpose')

var ASC = [-12, 7] // dimished second
var DESC = [12, -7] // descending dimished second

/**
 * Get the enharmonics of a note. It returns an array of three elements: the
 * below enharmonic, the note, and the upper enharmonic
 *
 * @name note.enharmonics
 * @function
 * @param {String} pitch - the pitch to get the enharmonics from
 * @return {Array} an array of pitches ordered by distance to the given one
 *
 * @example
 * enharmonics = require('music.kit/note.enharmonics')
 * enharmonics('C') // => ['B#', 'C', 'Dbb']
 * enharmonics('A') // => ['G##', 'A', 'Bbb']
 * enharmonics('C#4') // => ['B##3', 'C#4' 'Db4']
 * enharmonics('Db') // => ['C#', 'Db', 'Ebbb'])
 */
module.exports = function (pitch) {
  var enharmonics = []
  enharmonics.push(transpose(DESC, pitch))
  enharmonics.push(pitch)
  enharmonics.push(transpose(ASC, pitch))
  return enharmonics
}

name: note.enharmonics

params.title: param
params.description: the pitch to get the enharmonics from
params.name: pitch

returns.title: returns
returns.description: an array of pitches ordered by distance to the given one

examples: enharmonics = require('music.kit/note.enharmonics') enharmonics('C') // => ['B#', 'C', 'Dbb'] enharmonics('A') // => ['G##', 'A', 'Bbb'] enharmonics('C#4') // => ['B##3', 'C#4' 'Db4'] enharmonics('Db') // => ['C#', 'Db', 'Ebbb'])

description:
Get the pitch frequency in herzs with custom concert tuning

This function is currified so it can be partially applied (see examples)

tags.title: example

context.code:
'use strict'

var midi = require('./midi')

/**
 * Get the pitch frequency in herzs with custom concert tuning
 *
 * This function is currified so it can be partially applied (see examples)
 *
 * @name note.freq
 * @function
 * @param {Float} tuning - the frequency of A4 (null means 440)
 * @param {String|Array} note - the note name
 * @return {Float} the frequency of the note
 *
 * @example
 * note.freq(null, 'A4') // => 440
 * note.freq(444, 'A4') // => 444
 *
 * @example
 * // partially applied
 * ['A4', 'A#4', 'B5'].map(note.freq(440)) // => [440, ...]
 * var baroque = note.freq(415)
 * baroque('A3') // => 207.5
 */
module.exports = function freq (tuning, pitch) {
  tuning = tuning || 440
  if (arguments.length > 1) return freq(tuning)(pitch)

  return function (p) {
    if (!isNaN(p)) return p
    var m = midi(p)
    if (!m) return null
    return Math.pow(2, (m - 69) / 12) * tuning
  }
}

name: note.freq

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the frequency of the note

examples: note.freq(null, 'A4') // => 440 note.freq(444, 'A4') // => 444
// partially applied ['A4', 'A#4', 'B5'].map(note.freq(440)) // => [440, ...] var baroque = note.freq(415) baroque('A3') // => 207.5

description:
Get the note name (in scientific notation) of the given midi number

It uses MIDI's [Tuning Standard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MIDI_Tuning_Standard)
where A4 is 69

This method doesn't take into account diatonic spelling. Always the same
pitch class is given for the same midi number.

context.code:
'use strict'

var CHROMATIC = [ 'C', 'Db', 'D', 'Eb', 'E', 'F', 'Gb', 'G', 'Ab', 'A', 'Bb', 'B' ]

/**
 * Get the note name (in scientific notation) of the given midi number
 *
 * It uses MIDI's [Tuning Standard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MIDI_Tuning_Standard)
 * where A4 is 69
 *
 * This method doesn't take into account diatonic spelling. Always the same
 * pitch class is given for the same midi number.
 *
 * @name note.fromMidi
 * @function
 * @param {Integer} midi - the midi number
 * @return {String} the pitch
 *
 * @example
 * note.fromMidi(69) // => 'A4'
 */
module.exports = function (midi) {
  if (isNaN(midi) || midi < 0 || midi > 127) return null
  var name = CHROMATIC[midi % 12]
  var oct = Math.floor(midi / 12) - 1
  return name + oct
}

name: note.fromMidi

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the pitch

examples: note.fromMidi(69) // => 'A4'

description:
Get the midi number of a note

The note can be an string in scientific notation or
[array pitch notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)

tags.title: param
tags.description: the note in string or array notation
tags.name: note

tags.title: example
tags.description:
midi('A4') // => 69
midi('A3') // => 57
midi([0, 2]) // => 36 (C2 in array notation)

context.code:
'use strict'

var height = require('../pitch/height')
/**
 * Get the midi number of a note
 *
 * The note can be an string in scientific notation or
 * [array pitch notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)
 *
 * @name note.midi
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} note - the note in string or array notation
 * @return {Integer} the midi number
 *
 * @example
 * midi('A4') // => 69
 * midi('A3') // => 57
 * midi([0, 2]) // => 36 (C2 in array notation)
 */
module.exports = function (note) {
  var m = height(note) + 12
  return m < 0 || m > 127 ? null : m
}

description:
Convert from [scientific pitch notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_pitch_notation)
to [array pitch notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)

The string to parse must be in the form of: `letter[accidentals][octave]`
The accidentals can be up to four # (sharp) or b (flat) or two x (double sharps)

This function is cached for better performance.

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the note in array notation or null if not valid note

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var parse = require('music.kit/note.parse')
parse('C') // => [ 0 ]
parse('c#') // => [ 8 ]
parse('c##') // => [ 16 ]
parse('Cx') // => [ 16 ] (double sharp)
parse('Cb') // => [ -6 ]
parse('db') // => [ -4 ]
parse('G4') // => [ 2, 3, null ]
parse('c#3') // => [ 8, -1, null ]

context.code:
'use strict'

var REGEX = /^([a-gA-G])(#{1,}|b{1,}|x{1,}|)(-?\d*)(?:\/(\d+))?$/
var BASES = { C: [0, 0], D: [2, -1], E: [4, -2], F: [-1, 1], G: [1, 0], A: [3, -1], B: [5, -2] }
var cache = {}

/**
 * Convert from [scientific pitch notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_pitch_notation)
 * to [array pitch notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)
 *
 * The string to parse must be in the form of: `letter[accidentals][octave]`
 * The accidentals can be up to four # (sharp) or b (flat) or two x (double sharps)
 *
 * This function is cached for better performance.
 *
 * @name note.parse
 * @function
 * @param {String} str - the string to parse
 * @return {Array} the note in array notation or null if not valid note
 *
 * @example
 * var parse = require('music.kit/note.parse')
 * parse('C') // => [ 0 ]
 * parse('c#') // => [ 8 ]
 * parse('c##') // => [ 16 ]
 * parse('Cx') // => [ 16 ] (double sharp)
 * parse('Cb') // => [ -6 ]
 * parse('db') // => [ -4 ]
 * parse('G4') // => [ 2, 3, null ]
 * parse('c#3') // => [ 8, -1, null ]
 */
module.exports = function (str) {
  return (str in cache) ? cache[str] : cache[str] = parse(str)
}

function parse (str) {
  var m = REGEX.exec(str)
  if (!m) return null

  var base = BASES[m[1].toUpperCase()]
  var alt = m[2].replace(/x/g, '##').length
  if (m[2][0] === 'b') alt *= -1
  var fifths = base[0] + 7 * alt
  if (!m[3]) return [fifths]
  var oct = +m[3] + base[1] - 4 * alt
  return [fifths, oct, m[4] ? +m[4] : null]
}

name: note.parse

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the note in array notation or null if not valid note

examples: var parse = require('music.kit/note.parse') parse('C') // => [ 0 ] parse('c#') // => [ 8 ] parse('c##') // => [ 16 ] parse('Cx') // => [ 16 ] (double sharp) parse('Cb') // => [ -6 ] parse('db') // => [ -4 ] parse('G4') // => [ 2, 3, null ] parse('c#3') // => [ 8, -1, null ]

description: Get the [pitch class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pitch_class) of a note

context.code:
'use strict'

var operation = require('../pitch/operation')

/**
 * Get the [pitch class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pitch_class) of a note
 *
 * @name note.pitchClass
 * @param {String|Array} note the note
 * @return {String|Array} the pitch class
 *
 * @example
 * pc = require('music.kit/note.pitchClass')
 * pc('db3') // => 'Db'
 * pc('fx/4') // => 'F##'
 */
module.exports = operation(function (n) {
  return [n[0]]
})

description: Set the octave of the given note

tags.title: returns
tags.description: a copy of the same note with the octave changed

context.code:
var curry = require('../_curry')
var operation = require('../pitch/operation')

/**
 * Set the octave of the given note
 *
 * @name note.setOctave
 * @function
 * @param {Integer} octave - the octave to set
 * @param {String|Array} note - the note
 * @return {String|Array} a copy of the same note with the octave changed
 *
 * @example
 * var setOctave = require('music.kit/note.setOctave')
 * setOctave('2', 'C#1') // => 'C#2'
 */
module.exports = curry(operation(function (oct, n) {
  if (!Array.isArray(n)) return null
  return [n[0], -Math.floor(n[0] * 7 / 12) + oct, n[2] || null]
}))

name: note.setOctave

returns.title: returns
returns.description: a copy of the same note with the octave changed

examples: var setOctave = require('music.kit/note.setOctave') setOctave('2', 'C#1') // => 'C#2'

description:
Convert from [array notation](https://github.com/danigb/music.array.notation)
to [scientific pitch notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_pitch_notation)

Array length must be 1 or 3 (see array notation documentation)

The returned string format is `letter[+ accidentals][+ octave][/duration]` where the letter
is always uppercase, and the accidentals, octave and duration are optional.

This function is memoized for better perfomance.

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the note in scientific notation or null if not valid note array

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var note = require('music.kit').note
note.str([0]) // => 'F'
note.str([0, 4]) // => null (its an interval)
note.str([0, 4, null]) // => 'F4'
note.str([0, 4, 2]) // => 'F4/2'

examples: var note = require('music.kit').note note.str([0]) // => 'F' note.str([0, 4]) // => null (its an interval) note.str([0, 4, null]) // => 'F4' note.str([0, 4, 2]) // => 'F4/2'

description:
Transpose a note by an interval.

This function is currified. The orider of the parameters is indiferent.

tags.title: param
tags.description:
the interval. If its false, the note is not
transposed.
tags.name: interval

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var transpose = require('music.kit/note.transpose')
transpose('3m', 'C4') // => 'Eb4'
transpose('C4', '3m') // => 'Eb4'
tranpose([1, 0, 2], [3, -1, 0]) // => [3, 0, 2]
['C', 'D', 'E'].map(transpose('3M')) // => ['E', 'F#', 'G#']

context.code:
var operation = require('../pitch/operation')
var curry = require('../_curry')

/**
 * Transpose a note by an interval.
 *
 * This function is currified. The orider of the parameters is indiferent.
 *
 * @name note.transpose
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} interval - the interval. If its false, the note is not
 * transposed.
 * @param {String|Array} note - the note to transpose
 * @return {String|Array} the note transposed
 *
 * @example
 * var transpose = require('music.kit/note.transpose')
 * transpose('3m', 'C4') // => 'Eb4'
 * transpose('C4', '3m') // => 'Eb4'
 * tranpose([1, 0, 2], [3, -1, 0]) // => [3, 0, 2]
 * ['C', 'D', 'E'].map(transpose('3M')) // => ['E', 'F#', 'G#']
 */
module.exports = curry(operation(function (i, n) {
  if (i === false) return n
  else if (!Array.isArray(i) || !Array.isArray(n)) return null
  else if (i.length === 1 || n.length === 1) return [n[0] + i[0]]
  var d = i.length === 2 && n.length === 2 ? null : n[2] || i[2]
  return [n[0] + i[0], n[1] + i[1], d]
}))

name: note.transpose

params.title: param
params.description:
the interval. If its false, the note is not
transposed.
params.name: interval

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the note transposed

examples: var transpose = require('music.kit/note.transpose') transpose('3m', 'C4') // => 'Eb4' transpose('C4', '3m') // => 'Eb4' tranpose([1, 0, 2], [3, -1, 0]) // => [3, 0, 2] ['C', 'D', 'E'].map(transpose('3M')) // => ['E', 'F#', 'G#']

description:
In music.kit a pitch it's a note, an interval or a pitch class. It allows us
to work with this elements in an uniform way.

All the function in this module are valid for notes, or intervals

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * In music.kit a pitch it's a note, an interval or a pitch class. It allows us
 * to work with this elements in an uniform way.
 *
 * All the function in this module are valid for notes, or intervals
 *
 * @name pitch
 *
 * @example
 * var pitch = require('music.kit').pitch
 * pitch.height('C2') // => 24
 * pitch.height('5P') // => 7
 */
module.exports = {
  parse: require('./pitch/parse'),
  str: require('./pitch/str'),
  props: require('./pitch/props'),
  simplify: require('./pitch/simplify'),
  height: require('./pitch/height'),
  operation: require('./pitch/operation')
}

name: pitch
examples: var pitch = require('music.kit').pitch pitch.height('C2') // => 24 pitch.height('5P') // => 7

tags.title: param
tags.description: the pitch to get the height from
tags.name: pitch

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the height of -1 if not valid note

context.code:
'use strict'

var operation = require('./operation')

/**
 * @name pitch.height
 *
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} pitch - the pitch to get the height from
 * @return {Integer} the height of -1 if not valid note
 */
module.exports = operation(function (p) {
  if (!Array.isArray(p)) return -Infinity
  var f = p[0] * 7
  var o = p[1] || p[1] === 0 ? p[1] : -Math.floor(f / 12) - 10
  return f + o * 12
})

params.title: param
params.description: the pitch to get the height from
params.name: pitch

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the height of -1 if not valid note

var pn = require('../note/parse')
var pi = require('../interval/parse')

/**
 * Parse a note or an interval

 * @name pitch.parse

 * @return {Array} the pitch in array notation
 *
 * @example
 * pitch.parse('C2') // => [0, 2, null]
 * pitch.parse('5P') // => [1, 0]
 */
module.exports = function (n) { return pn(n) || pi(n) }

description:
Get the properties of a pitch in array notation as an array of properties

The properties is in the form [number, alteration, octave, duration]

__This is the only function in music.kit that only accepts array.notation format__

context.code:
'use strict'

// Map from number of fifths to interval number (0-index) and octave
// -1 = fourth, 0 = unison, 1 = fifth, 2 = second, 3 = sixth...
var BASES = [[3, 1], [0, 0], [4, 0], [1, -1], [5, -1], [2, -2], [6, -2], [3, -3]]

/**
 * Get the properties of a pitch in array notation as an array of properties
 *
 * The properties is in the form [number, alteration, octave, duration]
 *
 * __This is the only function in music.kit that only accepts array.notation format__
 *
 * @name pitch.props
 * @function
 * @param {Array} array - the pitch in array notation
 * @return {Array} the properties array
 *
 * @example
 * var props = require('music.kit/pitch.props')
 * props([2, 1, 4]) // => [1, 2, 4]
 */
module.exports = function (arr) {
  if (!Array.isArray(arr)) return null
  var index = (arr[0] + 1) % 7
  if (index < 0) index = 7 + index
  var base = BASES[index]
  var alter = Math.floor((arr[0] + 1) / 7)
  var oct = arr.length === 1 ? null : arr[1] - base[1] + alter * 4
  var dur = arr[2] ? '/' + arr[2] : null
  return [base[0], alter, oct, dur]
}

name: pitch.props

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the properties array

examples: var props = require('music.kit/pitch.props') props([2, 1, 4]) // => [1, 2, 4]

description:
Simplifies a pitch. If its a note, it returns its pitch class. If its an
interval it returns the simplified interval

context.code:
var operation = require('./operation')

/**
 * Simplifies a pitch. If its a note, it returns its pitch class. If its an
 * interval it returns the simplified interval
 *
 * @name pitch.simplify
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} pitch - the pitch
 * @return {String|Array} the simplified pitch
 *
 * @example
 * var simplify = require('music.kit/pitch.simplify')
 * simplify('C#4') // => 'C#'
 * simplify('9m') // => '2m'
 */
module.exports = operation(function (p) {
  if (!Array.isArray(p)) return null
  return p.length === 2 ? [p[0], -Math.floor(p[0] * 7 / 12)] : [p[0]]
})

name: pitch.simplify

examples: var simplify = require('music.kit/pitch.simplify') simplify('C#4') // => 'C#' simplify('9m') // => '2m'

var ns = require('../note/str')
var is = require('../interval/str')

/**
 * Convert a pitch in array notation to string. It deals with notes, pitch
 * classes and intervals.
 *
 * @name pitch.str
 * @function
 * @param {Array} pitch - the pitch in array notation
 * @return {String} the pitch string
 *
 * @example
 * // pitch class
 * pitch.str([0]) // => 'C'
 * // interval
 * pitch.str([0, 0]) // => '1P'
 * // note
 * pitch.str([0, 2, 4]) // => 'C2/4'
 */
module.exports = function (n) { return ns(n) || is(n) }

description:
In music.kit an scale is a set of notes or intervals with a tonic and ordered
by pitch

The `scale` module has functions to create and manipulate scales

context.code:
var scale = require('./scale/build')
scale.pattern = require('./scale/pattern')
scale.get = require('./scale/get')
scale.names = require('./scale/names')

module.exports = scale

name: scale

description:
Build a scale from a source and a tonic. A scale is a set of notes or
intervals ordered by frequency with a tonic.

A source can be a list of intervals or notes. The tonic must be
a pitch (with or without octave) or false to get the scale intervals

This function is currified, so you can partially apply the function passing
one parameter instead of two (see example)

This function is exported in music.kit as `scale` instead of `scale.build`
(see example)

tags.title: param
tags.description: the list of intervals or notes
tags.name: source

tags.title: example
example
example

name: scale.build

params.title: param
params.description: the list of intervals or notes
params.name: source

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the list of notes

examples: var scale = require('music.kit/scale/build') // basic usage scale('1 2 3 5 6', 'G') // => ['G', 'A', 'B', 'D', 'E'] scale('1 2 3 5 6', false) // => ['1P', '2M', '3M', '5P', '6M']
// partially applied var dorian = scale('D E F G A B C') dorian('C4') // => ['C4', 'D4', 'Eb4', 'F4', 'G4', 'A4', 'Bb4']
// music.kit exports 'scale' var kit = require('music.kit') kit.scale('D E F G A B C')

description: Scale dictionary

tags.title: example

var scales = require('music.kit/scale/dictionary')
scales['major'] // => { name: 'major', intervals: ['1', '2', ...], aliases: [] }

context.code:
'use strict'

var data = require('./scales.json')
var dictionary = require('../dictionary/build')

/**
 * Scale dictionary
 *
 * @name scale.dictionary
 * @kind constant
 *
 * @example
 * var scales = require('music.kit/scale/dictionary')
 * scales['major'] // => { name: 'major', intervals: ['1', '2', ...], aliases: [] }
 */
module.exports = dictionary(data)

name: scale.dictionary
examples: var scales = require('music.kit/scale/dictionary') scales['major'] // => { name: 'major', intervals: ['1', '2', ...], aliases: [] }

description:
Get a scale by name using a dictionary.

You can get scale notes by passing a tonic or the scale intervals by passing
`false` as tonic

There is two ways to get a scale:
- With name and tonic: `scale.get('major', 'C')`
- With tonic included in name: `scale.get('C major')`

This function can be partially applied (see examples)

tags.title: param
tags.description: the scale name (optionally can include the tonic)
tags.name: name

tags.title: returns
tags.description: a data object with the scale properties

tags.title: example

context.code:
'use strict'

var scales = require('./dictionary')
var getter = require('../dictionary/getter')

/**
 * Get a scale by name using a dictionary.
 *
 * You can get scale notes by passing a tonic or the scale intervals by passing
 * `false` as tonic
 *
 * There is two ways to get a scale:
 * - With name and tonic: `scale.get('major', 'C')`
 * - With tonic included in name: `scale.get('C major')`
 *
 * This function can be partially applied (see examples)
 *
 * @name scale.get
 * @function
 * @param {String} name - the scale name (optionally can include the tonic)
 * @return {Object} a data object with the scale properties
 *
 * @example
 * var get = require('music.kit/scale/get')
 * // with name and tonic
 * get('major', 'C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']
 * // with tonic inside the name
 * get('C major') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']
 * // partially applied
 * var major = get('major')
 * major('C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']
 */
module.exports = getter(scales)

name: scale.get

params.title: param
params.description: the scale name (optionally can include the tonic)
params.name: name

returns.title: returns
returns.description: a data object with the scale properties

examples: var get = require('music.kit/scale/get') // with name and tonic get('major', 'C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B'] // with tonic inside the name get('C major') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B'] // partially applied var major = get('major') major('C') // => ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']

description: Given a list of notes get the scale names

tags.title: returns
tags.description: an array of scale names or all known scale names if no arguments provided

tags.title: example
tags.description:
// get all known scale names
scale.names() // => ['major', 'minor', ... ] (89 names)
scale.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]
scale.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]

context.code:
'use strict'

var data = require('./scales.json')
var names = require('../dictionary/names')
var scales = require('./dictionary')

/**
 * Given a list of notes get the scale names
 *
 * @name scale.names
 * @function
 * @param {String|Array} notes - the scale notes
 * @return {Array} an array of scale names or all known scale names if no arguments provided
 *
 * @example
 * // get all known scale names
 * scale.names() // => ['major', 'minor', ... ] (89 names)
 * scale.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]
 * scale.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]
 */
module.exports = names(Object.keys(data), scales, ' ')

name: scale.names

returns.title: returns
returns.description: an array of scale names or all known scale names if no arguments provided

examples: // get all known scale names scale.names() // => ['major', 'minor', ... ] (89 names) scale.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ] scale.names('D E F G A B C') [ 'D dorian' ]

description:
Select notes from a scale using degree numbers.

The resulting array will contain the notes in the same order as degrees.
If a given degree is not present in the scale, the result will contain a
null in that position.

This function is currified so it can be partially applied.

tags.title: returns
tags.description: the melodic pattern (or null if not present)

tags.title: example

name: scale.pattern

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the melodic pattern (or null if not present)

examples: var pattern = require('music.kit/scale.pattern') // basic usage: pattern('1 3 5', 'C D E F G A B') // => [ 'C', 'E', 'G' ] // order matters: pattern('1 5 2 6', 'C D E F G A B') // => [ 'C', 'G', 'D', 'A' ] // not found degrees are null: pattern('1 2 6', 'C D E F G') // => [ 'C', 'D', null ] // numbers bigger than 7 are transposed one octave or more: pattern('1 8 15', 'C2 D2 E2') // => ['C2', 'C3', 'C4'] // partially applied: var triad = scale.pattern('1 3 5') triad('C D E F G A B') // => ['C', 'E', 'G']

description:
In music.kit a set is a collection of pitch classes (or simple intervals)
sorted in ascending order

The `set` module has functions to create and manipulate set

context.code:
'use strict'

/**
 * In music.kit a set is a collection of pitch classes (or simple intervals)
 * sorted in ascending order
 *
 * The `set` module has functions to create and manipulate set
 */
var set = require('./set/build')
set.binary = require('./set/binary.js')
set.fromBinary = require('./set/fromBinary.js')

module.exports = set

name: set

description:
Get a set binary number

A set binary number is a 12 digit binary, each digit representing a step
in the chromatic scale. For example, `101010000000` is `['1P', '2M', '3M']`

The set binary number is very useful to check if two sets are equal or
contains same intervals (regarding of note names)

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var binary = require('music.kit/set/binary')
binary('C2 E4 D3') // => '101010000000'

name: set.binary

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the binary number

examples: var binary = require('music.kit/set/binary') binary('C2 E4 D3') // => '101010000000'

description:
A set is a list of uniq pitch classes or simplified intervals in ascending pitch order

This function is exported as `set` (see examples)

tags.title: example
example

name: set.build

returns.title: returns
returns.description: the set

examples: var set = require('music.kit/set/build') set('E7 C2 e D5 c1') // => ['C', 'D', 'E'] set('11 10 9') // => [ '2M', '3M', '4P' ]
// use the function from music.kit var kit = require('music.kit') kit.set('e4 f5 ...')
